text: January 2015
astronauts onboard the International
Space Station eagerly await the arrival
of a supply ship not only is there extra
spare Parsley's gifts fresh food usually
this is a fun time this is a good time
but that good mood is about to be
shattered
two days later the astronauts are still
unpacking and something completely
unexpected interrupts the routine as
they're unloading all this equipment the
alarm starts sounding when you hear the
alarm in the space station you need to
move fast
the sensors indicate there is something
wrong with the air inside the space
station there's some kind of toxic gas
leak in environment which is a huge
problem you can't roll down a window to
air of the space you have to deal with
the environment as it is the crew
immediately put on gas masks and retreat
to the Russian section on the ground
NASA technicians scramble to find out
what the sensors have detected the data
coming from the sensors doesn't seem to
make sense it suggests a leak of toxic
ammonia but to check that the astronauts
will have to put themselves in danger
figuring out what caused the original
alarm requires you to measure the
ammonia level in the American side
but the equipment to do that is on the
American side where you're not allowed
to go what do you do now even more
mysteriously readings from the thermal
control system show no evidence that
ammonia is leaking something else is
going on the crew opens the hatch and

out there is no ammonia in their
disposal say there's no indication that

you are go to doc Matt but as soon as

and they're forced to evacuate yet again
the crew retreat back to the Russian
side of the station out of options NASA
goes back to basics
Mission Control takes the i.t approach
and has them turn the computers off and
then back on its computers 101 but guess
what it works the alarm resets and the
crew can reenter the module an
investigation determines that a computer
malfunction caused the second alarm the
pressure sensors were set off for a
couple of reasons first the ventilation
system was turned off
second the breathing masks they were
using we're adding gas to the module
with every breath that they took the
default indication in this case
fortunately turned out to be a false
